ucdp_ged_sb_best_sum.name: (UCDP) Observed fatalities, state-based conflict
ucdp_ged_sb_best_sum.description: The best (most likely) estimate of the total number of battle-related deaths (BRDs), disaggregated for state-based conflict per the Uppsala Conflict Data Program (UCDP) [definitions](https://www.pcr.uu.se/research/ucdp/definitions/) in the UCDP Georeferenced Events Dataset (UCDP GED) and the UCDP Candidate Events Dataset (UCDP Candidate).

source.dataset: UCDP Georeferenced Events Dataset (GED) Global version 23.1; UCDP Candidate Events Dataset (UCDP Candidate) version 23.0.1 through version 23.0.6
source.citation: Davies et al. 2022. Organized violence 1989-2021 and drone warfare. Journal of Peace Research 59(4); Sundberg & Melander. 2013. Introducing the UCDP Georeferenced Event Dataset. Journal of Peace Research 50(4).

ucdp_ged_ns_best_sum.name: (UCDP) Observed fatalities, non-state conflict
ucdp_ged_ns_best_sum.description: The best (most likely) estimate of the total number of battle-related deaths (BRDs), disaggregated for non-state conflict per the Uppsala Conflict Data Program (UCDP) [definitions](https://www.pcr.uu.se/research/ucdp/definitions/) in the UCDP Georeferenced Events Dataset (UCDP GED) and the UCDP Candidate Events Dataset (UCDP Candidate).

source.dataset: UCDP Georeferenced Events Dataset (GED) Global version 23.1; UCDP Candidate Events Dataset (UCDP Candidate) version 23.0.1 through version 23.0.6
source.citation: Davies et al. 2022. Organized violence 1989-2021 and drone warfare. Journal of Peace Research 59(4); Sundberg & Melander. 2013. Introducing the UCDP Georeferenced Event Dataset. Journal of Peace Research 50(4).

ucdp_ged_ns_best_count.name: (UCDP) Count of observed conflict events, non-state conflict
ucdp_ged_ns_best_count.description: Count of the total number of observed non-state conflict events, per the Uppsala Conflict Data Program (UCDP) [definitions](https://www.pcr.uu.se/research/ucdp/definitions/). Aggregated from the UCDP Georeferenced Events Dataset (UCDP GED) and/or the UCDP Candidate Events Dataset (UCDP Candidate).

source.dataset: UCDP Georeferenced Events Dataset (GED) Global version 23.1; UCDP Candidate Events Dataset (UCDP Candidate) version 23.0.1 through version 23.0.6
source.citation: Davies et al. 2022. Organized violence 1989-2021 and drone warfare. Journal of Peace Research 59(4); Sundberg & Melander. 2013. Introducing the UCDP Georeferenced Event Dataset. Journal of Peace Research 50(4).

ucdp_ged_os_best_count.name: (UCDP) Count of observed conflict events, one-sided violence
ucdp_ged_os_best_count.description: Count of the total number of observed conflict events in the one-sided violence category, per the Uppsala Conflict Data Program (UCDP) [definitions](https://www.pcr.uu.se/research/ucdp/definitions/). Aggregated from the UCDP Georeferenced Events Dataset (UCDP GED) and/or the UCDP Candidate Events Dataset (UCDP Candidate).

source.dataset: UCDP Georeferenced Events Dataset (GED) Global version 23.1; UCDP Candidate Events Dataset (UCDP Candidate) version 23.0.1 through version 23.0.6
source.citation: Davies et al. 2022. Organized violence 1989-2021 and drone warfare. Journal of Peace Research 59(4); Sundberg & Melander. 2013. Introducing the UCDP Georeferenced Event Dataset. Journal of Peace Research 50(4).

ucdp_ged_os_best_sum.name: (UCDP) Observed fatalities, one-sided violence
ucdp_ged_os_best_sum.description: The best (most likely) estimate of the total number of battle-related deaths (BRDs), disaggregated for one-sided violence per the Uppsala Conflict Data Program (UCDP) [definitions](https://www.pcr.uu.se/research/ucdp/definitions/) in the UCDP Georeferenced Events Dataset (UCDP GED) and the UCDP Candidate Events Dataset (UCDP Candidate).

source.dataset: UCDP Georeferenced Events Dataset (GED) Global version 23.1; UCDP Candidate Events Dataset (UCDP Candidate) version 23.0.1 through version 23.0.6
source.citation: Davies et al. 2022. Organized violence 1989-2021 and drone warfare. Journal of Peace Research 59(4); Sundberg & Melander. 2013. Introducing the UCDP Georeferenced Event Dataset. Journal of Peace Research 50(4).

vdem_v12_v2x_rule.name: (V-Dem) Rule of law index
vdem_v12_v2x_rule.description: Index for the question 'To what extent are laws transparently, independently, predictably, impartially, and equally enforced, and to what extent do the actions of government officials comply with the law?'

source.dataset: Coppedge et al. 2022. 'V-Dem Country-Year Dataset v12' Varieties of Democracy (V-Dem) Project. https://doi.org/10.23696/vdemds22
source.citation: Pemstein et al. 2022. 'The V-Dem Measurement Model: Latent Variable Analysis for Cross-National and Cross-Temporal Expert-Coded Data'. V-Dem Working Paper No. 21. 7th edition. University of Gothenburg: Varieties of Democracy Institute; Coppedge et al. 2022. 'V-Dem Codebook v12' Varieties of Democracy (V-Dem) Project

vdem_v12_v2x_gender.description: Answers the question 'How politically empowered are women?'

wb_wdi_ny_gdp_pcap_kd.name: (WB WDI) GDP per capita (constant 2015 US$)
wb_wdi_ny_gdp_pcap_kd.description: GDP per capita is gross domestic product divided by midyear population. GDP is the sum of gross value added by all resident producers in the economy plus any product taxes and minus any subsidies not included in the value of the products. It is calculated without making deductions for depreciation of fabricated assets or for depletion and degradation of natural resources. Data are in constant 2015 U.S. dollars.

update.comment: Accessed using the 3rd party app WBGAPI (https://pypi.org/project/wbgapi/) by means of a query of the WDI database (db=2).

source.citation: World Development Indicators, The World Bank

wb_wdi_sp_dyn_le00_in.name: (WB WDI) Life expectancy at birth, total (years)
wb_wdi_sp_dyn_le00_in.description: Life expectancy at birth indicates the number of years a newborn infant would live if prevailing patterns of mortality at the time of its birth were to stay the same throughout its life.

update.comment: Accessed using the 3rd party app WBGAPI (https://pypi.org/project/wbgapi/) by means of a query of the WDI database (db=2).

source.citation: World Development Indicators, The World Bank

wb_wdi_se_prm_nenr.name: (WB WDI) School enrollment, primary (% net)
wb_wdi_se_prm_nenr.description: Net enrollment rate is the ratio of children of official school age who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.

update.comment: Accessed using the 3rd party app WBGAPI (https://pypi.org/project/wbgapi/) by means of a query of the WDI database (db=2).

source.citation: World Development Indicators, The World Bank

wb_wdi_sp_pop_totl.name: (WB WDI) Total population
wb_wdi_sp_pop_totl.description: Total population is based on the de facto definition of population, which counts all residents regardless of legal status or citizenship. The values shown are midyear estimates.

update.comment: Accessed using the 3rd party app WBGAPI (https://pypi.org/project/wbgapi/) by means of a query of the WDI database (db=2).

source.citation: World Development Indicators, The World Bank

wb_wdi_sp_dyn_imrt_in.name: (WB WDI) Infant mortality rate per 1,000 live births
wb_wdi_sp_dyn_imrt_in.description: Infant mortality rate is the number of infants dying before reaching one year of age, per 1,000 live births in a given year.

update.comment: Accessed using the 3rd party app WBGAPI (https://pypi.org/project/wbgapi/) by means of a query of the WDI database (db=2).

source.citation: World Development Indicators, The World Bank

visualization.viz_main_legend: Infant mortality rate per 1,000 live births
